title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8187-2.3 - Complaints
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8187-2.3 - Complaints

State Regulations
(a) A complaint may
be brought by the mayor or city manager of a city, the supervisor of a town (if
a town has more than one supervisor, the presiding supervisor), a majority of
the members of the council of a city, a majority of the members of the town
board, or by an owner of record of taxable real property in a city or
town. (b) Within 30 days of receipt
of a complaint, the State Board shall acknowledge the receipt thereof to each
complainant and mail notice of the proceeding to the chief executive officer of
each city and town within the county. Any such city or town may thereafter
appear in the proceeding by filing a notice of appearance as provided in
section
8187-2.4
of this Subpart. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
§§
8187-2.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
